etymology.description: Phonetic 雍 (wēng) + Semantic 瓦 (wǎ, 'earthenware') = jar-shaped earthenware -> meaning jar
etymology.interpretation: The character 甕 (wèng, 'jar') combines the phonetic component 雍 (yōng, suggesting the sound) with the semantic element 瓦 (wǎ, 'earthenware'), conveying the idea of an earthen container typically used as a jar.

examples.chinese: 这口老瓮装满水(這口老瓮裝滿水)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kǒu lǎo wèng zhuāng mǎn shuǐ。
examples.english: This old jar is filled with water.

examples.chinese: 他从古巷找到一只精致的瓮(他從古巷找到一隻精緻的瓮)，用来存放秘密(用來存放秘密)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng gǔ xiàng zhǎodào yī zhī jīngzhì de wèng, yòng lái cúnfàng mìmì。
examples.english: He found an exquisite jar in an ancient alley, used to store secrets.
